DataElement.preferredName: Patient Dementia Cognitive Disability Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a patient enrolling on a clinical trial has an acquired organic mental disorder with loss of intellectual abilities of sufficient severity to interfere with social or occupational functioning OR has a dysfunction that is multifaceted and involves memory, behavior, personality, judgment, attention, spatial relations, language, abstract thought, and other executive functions that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Dementia Cognitive Disability Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An acquired organic mental disorder with loss of intellectual abilities of sufficient severity to interfere with social or occupational functioning. The dysfunction is multifaceted and involves memory, behavior, personality, judgment, attention, spatial relations, language, abstract thought, and other executive functions. The intellectual decline is usually progressive, and initially spares the level of consciousness._Cognitive; of or being or relating to or involving cognition._Any physical, mental, or functional impairment that limits a major activity.  It may be partial or complete. (Taber's)_Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: An acquired organic mental disorder with loss of intellectual abilities of sufficient severity to interfere with social or occupational functioning. The dysfunction is multifaceted and involves memory, behavior, personality, judgment, attention, spatial relations, language, abstract thought, and other executive functions. The intellectual decline is usually progressive, and initially spares the level of consciousness.:Cognitive; of or being or relating to or involving cognition.:Any physical, mental, or functional impairment that limits a major activity.  It may be partial or complete. (Taber's):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Loss of intellectual abilities interfering with an individual's social and occupational functions. Causes include Alzheimer's disease, brain injuries, brain tumors, and vascular disorders.
Of or being or relating to or involving cognition.
Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Diagnosis of dementia or cogn
ReferenceDocuments.description: Diagnosis of dementia or cognitive disability that will not allow their active participation in group sessions

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of moderate to profound intellectual disability (i.e. IQ <= 55)?
